Package com.ibm.streams.operator.control

Interface Controllable

public interface Controllable
Operator interface to establish control mechanisms in the Job Control Plane using JMX. Operators use this interface to:
  • Create MBeans in the Job Control Plane to allow external control or coordination between operators in the same application.
  • Add NotificationHandler instances to MBeans to react to control notifications, such as from external clients or state changes in other operators.
  • Invoke actions on MBeans to issue control notifications or allow operator management state to be visible to external clients.

A Controllable is connected to the Job Control Plane using ControlPlaneContext.connect(Controllable), which will result in the setup(MBeanServerConnection, OperatorContext) method being called asynchronously, as the Job Control Plane may not be active when the method is invoked.
The setup method will be called when a connection is made with the control plane. This allows operators to create MBeans in the Job Control Plane and register notification handlers. Note that this method may be called multiple times during the lifetime of the operator and thus must be defensively coded, specifically for these situations:

  • The operator has restarted but the Job Control has not. In this case MBeans created by the previous invocation of the operator will still exist in the Job Control Plane.
  • The connection between the operator and the Job Control Plane failed and has been automatically reconnected.
  • The PE containing the Job Control Plane has been restarted but the PE containing the operator has not.

Events for state of the connection to the Job Control Plane are sent to event(MBeanServerConnection, OperatorContext, EventType). When the event is of type Controllable.EventType.ConnectionOpened the call to event() preceeds the call to setup().

Notification handlers added directly or through a proxy are not maintained when the underlying connection to the Job Control Plane is closed or fails. Notification handling must be re-established after a failure using the setup() call.

A Java primitive operator may connect multiple Controllable instances to the Job Control Plane. If the same Controllable instance is connected more than once, then it will be invoked once per connect call.

Since:
InfoSphere® Streams Version 4.0

  • Field Details

    • IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT

      static final String IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • isApplicable

      boolean isApplicable(OperatorContext context)
      Is this Controllable applicable for this operator invocation. This method allows a Controllable to not be invoked if it is not applicable for the operator's invocation, and thus not initiate a connection to the control plane.
      This is invoked only once, if it returns false then setup and event will never be called.
      Parameters:
      context - OperatorContext for the Operator this Controllable is providing control for.
      Returns:
      True to allow connection of this Controllable to the Job Control Plane, false to ensure this Controllable will not be connected to the Job Control Plane.

    • event

      void event(MBeanServerConnection jcp, OperatorContext context, Controllable.EventType eventType)
      Notify this Controllable of a change in the connection to the Job Control Plane.
      If eventType is Controllable.EventType.ConnectionClosed or Controllable.EventType.ConnectionFailure then no attempt to contact the Job Control Plane using its MBeanServerConnection should be made.
      If eventType is Controllable.EventType.ConnectionOpened then setup() will be called after this method has returned. It is recommended that MBean creation and notification handling is performed in setup() as this method is only executed once per connection open.
      Parameters:
      jcp - MBeanServerConnection to Job Control Plane.
      context - OperatorContext for the Operator this Controllable is providing control for.
      eventType - Type of the connection event.

    • setup

      void setup(MBeanServerConnection jcp, OperatorContext context) throws InstanceNotFoundException, Exception
      Setup the Job Control Plane for this Controllable. Called when the connection to the Job Control Plane for the processing element is established or reconnected. This corresponds to a Controllable.EventType.ConnectionOpened event.
      If the method throws a InstanceNotFoundException then the method will be called again after a 100ms delay. This allows implementations to be tolerant of the undefined order and rate of operator initialization within the application.
      This method may be called by multiple threads but not concurrently. Each execution happens-after any previous execution.
      Parameters:
      jcp - Connection to the MBean server in the Job Control Plane. This reference will remain unchanged for the lifetime of the processing element and multiple calls to this method. The underlying connection to the control plane can fail and will re-connect automatically.
      context - Operator context for the operator that registered this Controllable.
      Throws:
      InstanceNotFoundException - If this exception is thrown then the method will be called again after a 100ms delay. This allows implementations to be tolerant of the undefined order and rate of operator initialization within the application.
      Exception - Exception trying to setup this Controllable with the Job Control Plane.
